meanings.definition: The space around the altar in a church.
meanings.sent1: The choir sang beautifully in the chancel.
meanings.sent2: The priest stood at the front of the chancel during the service.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat sneaked into the chancel and sat on the altar.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a sacred chancel, surrounded by peace and serenity.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streaming through the stained glass windows illuminated the chancel magnificently.

meanings.sent1: The architect will chancel the new church with a beautiful altar area.
meanings.sent2: They decided to chancel the small chapel to accommodate more worshippers.
meanings.sent3: The builders will chancel the old building into a stunning place of worship.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to chancel the community center into a peaceful sanctuary.
meanings.sent5: The team worked hard to chancel the hall, creating a serene space for gatherings.
